intro: Linosyris kerneriana, commonly known as the Kerner's linseed plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. This herbaceous perennial is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is adapted to grow in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
